author: @AlexandriaVAGov
title: An Intimate Reception with George Washington at Historic Duvall House | City of Alexandria, VA
text:
An Intimate Reception with George Washington at Historic Duvall House We invite you to experience An Intimate Reception with General George Washington on Saturday, November 15, from 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. at the Duvall House , 305 Cameron Street — the same elegant home where the General was feted by leading Alexandrians upon his triumphant return from the Revolutionary War in 1783.
In honor of America’s 250th Anniversary Year , General Washington will reflect on his most poignant memories from the war and the founding of the nation, while engaging guests in conversation about his life and times. Libations and heavy hors d’oeuvres will be served.
Tickets are $150 per person , with all proceeds benefiting the George Washington Birthday Celebration . Space is limited to just 40 guests , so advance reservations are encouraged.
Purchase tickets online at shop.alexandriava.gov/Events.aspx , or email gwbirthdayevents@gmail.com to reserve your space and arrange payment at the door.
About the Office of Historic Alexandria
The Office of Historic Alexandria preserves and shares the history of the City of Alexandria with eight museums, historic sites, archives, archaeology, tours, exhibits and public programs. Through powerful storytelling and confronting the City’s past, Historic Alexandria enriches the present and inspires the future. We enhance the quality of life for residents and visitors and serve as a partner in the City’s equity and inclusion initiatives. For more information, visit alexandriava.gov/Historic.
For reasonable disability accommodation, contact Nicole Quinn at historicalexandria@alexandriava.gov or call 703.746.4554, Virginia Relay 711.
If you prefer communication in another language, free interpretation and translation services are available to you, please email LanguageAccess@alexandriava.gov or call 703-746-3960.
